newswire.abstract: Donald Trump may push us into another war.

comments.commentBody:
In Trump's world there is only black and white, no nuances. Either China is friend or foe. Can't have it both ways. That is too much for him to comprehend.
In Trump's world, he is right and you are wrong. If he says China is a foe, it must be true because he is right, always right.
In Trump's world, no one deserves any credit for anything they've ever done. How is it possible for anyone else to have achieved anything since Trump has already mastered all there is to master.
All of this suggests that we are in for an authoritarian dictatorial style. Everything in this country now belongs to him. It is his fiefdom. And therefore it is fitting and obvious for him to show off HIS army to the rest of the country and world.
Fitting and obvious, but SAD!

comments.commentBody:
"This is a resolution I’m probably going to break, but I resolve to write about Trump only on the presidential level, not on the carnival level. I’m going to try to respond only to what he does, not what he says or tweets. I really wish some of my media confreres would do the same."

This is the resolution that ought to have been taken by all journalists and pundits when The Donald was a candidate and chances are that he would not have been the Republican nominee. It is not too late, however, even now to follow that dictum. Attention is the oxygen backyard bullies seek, and they'll fade and slither away when they get no attention.

newswire.abstract: The “mom in chief” charmed late-night hosts and hula-hooped with kids, but she wasn’t her full self in public.

comments.commentBody:
The can be only one Michelle Obama. We were truly fortunate to have had the Obamas in the White House and especially Michelle speaking out on varied social issues and causes. No family could better represent our country than theirs. No woman can make a better first lady.
As we move forward and have a longer arc of time to look back at these eight years, we will see that we had the most precious gems in the White House.
Good luck Mr. and Mrs. Obama!

House hunting may involve "People move close to people just like themselves."
Buts such is not the case with The Donald. He got a mere 20% support in his hometown. And if you think that is bad, wait till you see what support he got in his future hometown of Washington D.C. - He got less that 10%.
So neither NYC nor DC wants him to live there. I guess he must move to Alaska to be closer to Sarah Palin or Georgia to be closer to Newt Gingrich. I am sure he can afford to buy a house in either of these two states.

multimedia.copyright: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Trivial interventions won’t do much to change a $19 trillion economy, despite the public relations hype.

newswire.abstract: Hyping the trivial obscures reality.

comments.commentBody:
Fake policy from a fake man? What a surprise.
The US economy is a large ship that requires many parts to coexist for it to function smoothly. Anyone who says that he and he alone can fix it is spewing utter nonsense. It is as if the captain of the sinking Titanic said that he and he alone can keep the ship from sinking by merely moving a few people around.
America was duped by this con artist and now we will have to bear through four years of fake policy. I only wish the fourth estate would take its job more seriously. And the early signs are not very promising.

newswire.abstract: Republicans plan to replace Obamacare with TBD.

comments.commentBody:
Obamacare is not perfect, but there was nothing better at the time of the contentious negotiations way back in 2010. And so we have this creaky, albeit functioning law. And now the Republicans want to replace it since that is what they've been trying to do for the past six years. The problem, if we can call it that, is that they have no alternative. Which, of course, in their mind is not a problem at all. After all, as Kristof notes, "If the Republicans ran a home renovation business, they would start tearing down your roof this month and promise to return in 2019 with some options for a new one — if you survived."
There so many other metaphors but all of them say the same thing. Sad, very sad!! What is sadder is that the very people who are being helped by Obamacare are the ones who voted for these buffoons. Very sad indeed!!

comments.commentBody:
"They are conservative, believe in hard work, family, the military and cops, and they know that abortion and socialism are evil, that Jesus Christ is our savior, and that Donald J. Trump will be good for America."
I can understand and respect anyone who believes in hard work and family. But to believe that "abortion and socialism are evil" shows a sign of unawareness or that the person has been successfully programmed by propaganda, most likely Fox News. Combine that with the firm belief that "Jesus Christ is our savior" and you get the reason why they think The Donald is fit to lead America.
I could have used harsher terms to describe such thinking but that will reduce me to their thinking level in which all educated, thinking, coastal, kale eating liberals are elites who do not believe in hard work or family.

comments.commentBody:
Friedman astutely notes that in the future humankind will replace the old saying "I think, therefore I am" with "I emote, therefore I am."
This is all fine and well, but we have a President on the threshold of assuming office and a newly minted Congress that just now assumed office that can neither think nor emote. What else can one say about The Donald's cavalier attitude towards nuclear weapons other than he can neither think nor emote. Why else do you think we had the ethics office fiasco? It was definitely thoughtless and heartless.
I think it is important, even more so in the future, to be thoughtful and caring.

asset.assetTitle: Why Corporations Are Helping Donald Trump Lie About Jobs (02mon1)

taxonomies.name: Why Corporations Are Helping Donald Trump Lie About Jobs (02mon1)

newswire.title: Why Corporations Are Helping Donald Trump Lie About Jobs
newswire.abstract: The emerging, and dangerous, new form of crony capitalism.

comments.commentBody:
This is a perfect example of crony capitalism. In an accompanying column Prof. Krugman makes the same point and notes that we are not all that different from the many stans that came out of the erstwhile Soviet Union.
The editors also note that "It has become abundantly clear that Mr. Trump is easily distracted by shiny objects," but that is only half true. The media which fawns on every Trump move and the American public that waits and swallows his tweets are just as easily distracted by shiny objects.
Those of us who really want America to be an exceptional country must not fall for such baubles and stay focused and push back at The Donald and the media at every opportunity. This should be our New Year's resolution.
I am reminded of JFK's famous statement exhorting us to do something for the country and not ask what the country can do for us. Well, the country is asking for us not to be distracted by the shiny objects thrown our way by The Donald and stay focused on progressive policies. It is up to us to hold his feet to the fire!!

newswire.abstract: Rule of law is for the little people.

comments.commentBody:
Whenever The Donald, his crony cabinet members, or the Republicans talk about American exceptionalism, tell them that America is exceptionally ordinary, like the other stans. We have a strongman, a term I never thought I'd use in the context of America, at the helm. He is surrounded by crony capitalists who want to keep wages for workers "under control," which essentially means keeping it low. And the Republican Congress(wo)men make sycophants in the stans look like real tough folk.
I keep noting this in every comment and will do so once more: it is up to us, the progressive people, to continue pushing back at every opportunity. We may not win every battle but at least we should not allow them to win the war.

newswire.abstract: In 2017 we need to focus on substance, not celebrity.

comments.commentBody:
It is hard to disagree with the notion that the media failed in their duty to inform the public and “treated their viewers not as citizens, but as so many pairs of eyeballs." But singling the media would be a great disservice to other contributors. Here below in no particular order are a few more:

Fox News - Whereas the media may have been complicit in a general sort of manner, Fox news was an active promoter of untruths and half-truths. They took their slogan "fair and balanced" to new levels of unfairness and imbalance.

Social Media - All the unchecked and unverified pieces of information that were posted on FaceBook or Twitter freely circulated and, quite often, gained momentum and veracity along the way.

Gullible Americans - Let us call a spade a spade. We, the people, bought into the false information that was being circulated. Basically the skill of critical thinking and triangulation were shelved in favor of forwarding the falsities and half-truths as quickly as it came into our in box.

Into this milieu came The Donald who perfectly played his hand, And now we have him as POTUS. As I've been telling my family & friends and anyone within earshot, it is we, the people, who can brake this runaway freight train.

Welcome to 2017 - Happy New Year!!

comments.commentBody:
Douthat notes that "In a close race everything matters, Comey and WikiLeaks and everything else that liberals have reached for in their agony of blame."

These two - Comey and Wikileaks - are nothing more than the tip of an iceberg. Years and years of assault on Hillary Clinton brought us to the point where Comey and Wikileaks provided to be the tipping point.

There is only so much defense one can offer against a tsunami, which, in the end, won the day.

newswire.title: Take a Bad Year. And Make It Better.
newswire.abstract: On leaving 2016 behind.

comments.commentBody:
Let us not pick on 2016 as an exemplar of a bad year. We've had many bad years and we probably will have a few more. Here is how I look at it: 2016 is over, let us not worry about it. In fact it is too late to worry about it. Let us, instead, focus on 2017 and make it a better year, for all of us. Let us raise our voices in support of the underpaid, unemployed, unrepresented, underfed, and keep the pressure on our POTUS, Congress, and SCOTUS to do the right thing. I plan to send more money to support Planned Parenthood, ACLU, and other local institutions that will fight for and pursue progressive agendas.
So, even as I wish you all a Happy New Year, I want to remind you that it is we who can make 2017 a happy year!!

comments.commentBody:
This exchange demonstrates two things. First, the importance of Mikhail S. Gorbachev in the rough days of transition. Most Americans give credit, almost exclusively, to Ronald Reagan for ending the cold war. It has always been a myopic view that does not recognize the important role played by Mikhail S. Gorbachev. Absent him and his moderate and supportive stance, we could have had a nuclear holocaust of unimaginable proportions.
Second, it shows the importance of a steady hand at the helm. Imagine if Mikhail S. Gorbachev or George Bush were prone to tweeting insults and barbs on the fly. Maturity is the minimum requirement for any employment, particularly when that job gives one access to a huge nuclear arsenal.

comments.commentBody:
Tim Egan makes a fine point that the Democrats, in general, and Hillary Clinton, in particular, did not have a message with which people of different stripes could resonate. But that is a tad unfair. Not so much because I believe that Hillary Clinton had the right message but because Donald Trump had a false message. And many of his supporters gobbled it up like it was going out of style.
He maligned Mexicans, and many Latinos voted for him. He abused women, and many women voted for him. He abused Muslims, and many Muslims voted for him. There was not a single demographic segment that he did not antagonize, and yet they all flocked over to him.
He spread miasma, and the people breathed in those noxious fumes and got intoxicated. So, do blame the Democrats and Hillary Clinton, but do not for a minute think that the charlatan did not play Americans for fools.

newswire.abstract: We are sorely in need of some cheerful news out of Washington, so I’m going to tell you Barbara Mikulski’s story.

comments.commentBody:
I still remember the year Ms. Mikulski became Senator Mikulski. I remember the media becoming giddy and naming the year as "the Year of the Women."
And I hope future generations will remember 2016 as the year when the most qualified and competent candidate running for the office of POTUS was a woman.
It has been, and continues to be, a long slog. And the least we can do is to honor this brave women who have broken through the many hurdles thrown their way. Naming (or renaming) the Senate conference room is the least we can do in that regard.

comments.commentBody:
One of the reasons that kids from upper middle class educated families apply to elite institutions is because it gives them and their parents talking points in the company of their neighbors and friends.
One parent might say to his/her neighbor, "My daughter was admitted to Harvard, Williams and Dartmouth and she chose to go to Smith."
And the response might be, "My son had many choices including Princeton, Columbia, and Amherst but he chose to go to Stanford."
This race is as much about showing off your kids, and by extension, your family's standing and capabilities. Not that different that showing off your BMW.

newswire.abstract: The nuns were right about Russia after all.

comments.commentBody:
The one thing that comes through, time and time again, is that Trump will find a way to bend, twist, and squeeze facts that will take him to the conclusion he desires, If he wants the conclusion to be that Putin is is BFF, he'll refer to his tweeting or the fact the they were on the same 60 minutes program (albeit in separate continents) as a signal of that friendship. If he wants the conclusion to be that he does not even know Putin, he'll use the very same facts to come to the opposite conclusion.
He is a pathological liar, a sociopath, and an egotistical maniac. And that is a fact.
